stories.title: Internet Explorer's final resting place: as a 'world-class joke' in South Korea

stories.text:
I am currently developing an app that uses customised key-value stores, but am struggling to come up with a simple way to describe this concept.

In the app, users can add custom meta data to objects. For example, a 'restaurant' object can contain metadata with <Rating, Int>, <Website, URL>, <Menu, Photo> and so on. Other another example would be a 'walking goal' object with custom meta data of <Time Taken, Date> and <Steps, Int>

I'm thinking of words like 'properties' or 'attributes', but I think the word/concept can be simplified further.

Thanks in advance!
stories.title: Ask HN: Simplest word to describe key/value store?

stories.text: I’d like to read books faster, but I’m skeptical that the methods available will do anything beyond teaching me to skim - and I’m just the sort of person who finds a lot of magic in minor word choice. The idea of reading only 5 words in 8 repulses me.
stories.title: Ask HN: Have you had success with improving your reading speed?
